result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court.  
Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Andrian Dabary Coleman.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. 
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court.  
Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Andrian Dabary Coleman.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing. 
Defense request an adjournment.  Court grants one last adjournment. 
 If issues does not resolve on the next Court date, matter will be set for Jury Trial. 
Court ordered case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are working towards a global resolution.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court with Attorney Robert Hampton who appears on behalf of Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; parties appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman not in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE.  Defendant was ordered to be booked on May 7, by 5 pm.  Defendant failed to do so.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. 
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/07/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Andrian Dabary Coleman in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant didn't receive the summons so he didn't know that he had a court date and was out of town.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 5/5/2022, at 1:30 p.m. in OCCR
 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/22 @ 1:30p
